00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 #define MAX_LIST_SIZE 256
00013 
00014 enum type{
00015         msg_new,
00016         msg_int,
00017         msg_float,
00018         msg_list                                                // Also used for symbols
00019 };
00020 
00021 // Data Structure for this object
00022 typedef struct _change                  // Data Structure for this object
00023 {
00024         t_object                ob;     
00025         void                    *obex;
00026         void                    *change_Out[2];                                 // outlets
00027         void                    *inlet_right;                                   // 2nd inlet+
00028         short                   last_argc;
00029         t_atom                  *last_argv;
00030         Symbol                  *last_input_symbol;
00031         t_atom                  last_input_list[MAX_LIST_SIZE];
00032         long                    last_input_int;
00033         float                   last_input_float;
00034         type                    last_input_type;
00035 } t_change;
00036 
00037 // Prototypes for methods
00038 void change_assist(t_change *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);              // Assistance Method
00039 void *change_new(void);                                                                                                 // New Object Creation Method
00040 void change_free(t_change *x);
00041 void change_anything(t_change *x, Symbol *msg, long argc, Atom *argv);  // Symbol method
00042 void change_int(t_change *x, long value);
00043 void change_float(t_change *x, double value);
00044 float atom_getvalue(long index, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00045 void atom_copy(t_atom *dst, t_atom *src);
00046 bool atom_compare(Atom *in1, Atom *in2);
00047 
00048 // Globals
00049 t_class         *change_class;                  // Required. Global pointing to this class
00050 
00051 /************************************************************************************/
00052 // Main() Function
00053 
00054 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00055 {
00056         t_class *c;
00057         
00058         jamoma_init();
00059 
00060         // Define our class
00061         c = class_new("jcom.change",(method)change_new, (method)change_free, (short)sizeof(t_change), (method)0L, 0L, 0);
00062         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_change, obex));
00063 
00064         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)change_int,                          "int", A_GIMME, 0L);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)change_float,                        "float", A_GIMME, 0L);
00067         class_addmethod(c, (method)change_anything,                     "list", A_GIMME, 0L);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)change_anything,                     "anything", A_GIMME, 0L);
00069     class_addmethod(c, (method)change_assist,                   "assist", A_CANT, 0L); 
00070     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout", A_CANT,0);  
00071     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT, 0);
00072 
00073         // Finalize our class
00074         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00075         change_class = c;
00076         return 0;
00077 }
00078 
00079 
00080 /************************************************************************************/
00081 // Object Life
00082 
00083 void *change_new(void)
00084 {
00085         short i;
00086         t_change *x;                                                                    // Declare an object (based on our struct)
00087         x = (t_change *)object_alloc(change_class);             // Create object, store pointer to it (get 1 inlet free)
00088         if(x){
00089                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout      
00090                 x->change_Out[1] = bangout(x);                          // Create Outlets (right to left order)
00091             x->change_Out[0] = outlet_new(x, 0);                //      ...
00092 
00093         // Create Right Inlet (inletnum is 1)
00094                 x->inlet_right = proxy_new(x, 1, 0L);
00095 
00096         // Init the temp storage
00097         for(i=0; i<MAX_LIST_SIZE; i++)
00098                 atom_setsym(&(x->last_input_list[i]), _sym_nothing);                    
00099         }
00100         x->last_input_type = msg_new;                                   // Makes sure that first message receive goes to left outlet
00101         return (x);                                                                             // Return pointer to our instance
00102 }
00103 
00104 void change_free(t_change *x)
00105 {
00106         freeobject((t_object *)(x->inlet_right));
00107 }
00108 
00109 
00110 /************************************************************************************/
00111 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00112 
00113 // Method for Assistance Messages
00114 void change_assist(t_change *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00115 {
00116         if(msg==1)                                                      // Inlets
00117                 strcpy(dst, "Input");
00118         else if(msg==2){                                        // Outlets
00119                 switch(arg){
00120                         case 0: strcpy(dst, "Repetition Filtered Output"); break;
00121                         case 1: strcpy(dst, "(bang) input is the same as the last input"); break;
00122                         case 2: strcpy(dst, "dumpout"); break;
00123                 }
00124         }
00125 }
00126 
00127 
00128 // INPUT: INT/FLOAT
00129 void change_int(t_change *x, long value)
00130 {
00131         long    inlet = proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x);
00132 
00133         if(inlet == 0){
00134                 if((value != x->last_input_int) || (x->last_input_type != msg_int))
00135                         outlet_int(x->change_Out[0], value);
00136                 else
00137                         outlet_bang(x->change_Out[1]);
00138         }
00139         x->last_input_int = value;
00140         x->last_input_type = msg_int;
00141 }
00142 
00143 void change_float(t_change *x, double value)
00144 {
00145         long    inlet = proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x);
00146 
00147         if(inlet == 0){
00148                 if((value != x->last_input_float) || (x->last_input_type != msg_float))
00149                         outlet_float(x->change_Out[0], value);
00150                 else
00151                         outlet_bang(x->change_Out[1]);
00152         }
00153         x->last_input_float = value;
00154         x->last_input_type = msg_float;
00155 }
00156 
00157 
00158 // INPUT: LIST/SYMBOL
00159 void change_anything(t_change *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00160 {       
00161         short   i;
00162         bool    match = false;
00163         bool    mismatch = false;
00164         long    inlet = proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x);
00165                                                                                         
00166         if(inlet == 0){
00167                 if (x->last_input_type != msg_list)             // didn't receive a list/symbol last time
00168                         mismatch = true;
00169                 else if (msg != x->last_input_symbol)   // last list/symbol received didn't start with the same symbol
00170                         mismatch = true;
00171                 else if (argc != x->last_argc)                  // last list/symbol was not the same length
00172                         mismatch = true;
00173                 else {                                                                  // check to see if the args are the same...
00174                         for(i=0; i<argc; i++){
00175                                 match = atom_compare(&(x->last_input_list[i]), argv+i);                 
00176                                 if(!match) mismatch = true;
00177                         }
00178                 }
00179                         
00180                 if(mismatch)                                                    // output the input
00181                         outlet_anything(x->change_Out[0], msg, argc, argv);             
00182                 else                                                                    // All elements are the same, send a bang
00183                         outlet_bang(x->change_Out[1]);          
00184         }               
00185         x->last_input_symbol = msg;                                     // Make copies of the input for the next time
00186         x->last_input_type = msg_list;
00187         x->last_argc = argc;
00188         for(i=0;i<argc;i++)
00189                 atom_copy(&(x->last_input_list[i]), argv+i);
00190 }
00191

00193 // A utility for copying an atom
00194 void atom_copy(t_atom *dst, t_atom *src)
00195 {
00196         //dst[0].a_type = src[0].a_type;
00197         switch(src[0].a_type){
00198                 case A_LONG:
00199                         //dst[0].a_w.w_long = src[0].a_w.w_long;
00200                         atom_setlong(dst, atom_getlong(src));
00201                         break;
00202                 case A_FLOAT:
00203                         //dst[0].a_w.w_float = src[0].a_w.w_float;
00204                         atom_setfloat(dst, atom_getfloat(src));
00205                         break;
00206                 case A_SYM:
00207                         //dst[0].a_w.w_sym = src[0].a_w.w_sym;
00208                         atom_setsym(dst, atom_getsym(src));
00209                         break;
00210                 default:
00211                         error("could not copy atom!");
00212                         break;  
00213         }
00214 }
00215 
00216 
00217 // A utility for comparing two atoms
00218 bool atom_compare(Atom *in1, Atom *in2)
00219 {
00220         if((in1[0].a_type == A_LONG) && (in2[0].a_type == A_LONG)){
00221                 //if(in1[0].a_w.w_long == in2[0].a_w.w_long)
00222                 if((atom_getlong(in1))==(atom_getlong(in2)))
00223                         return true;
00224         }
00225         else if((in1[0].a_type == A_FLOAT) && (in2[0].a_type == A_FLOAT)){
00226                 if((atom_getfloat(in1))==(atom_getfloat(in2)))
00227                 //if(in1[0].a_w.w_float == in2[0].a_w.w_float)
00228                         return true;
00229         }
00230         else if((in1[0].a_type == A_SYM) && (in2[0].a_type == A_SYM)){
00231                 if((atom_getsym(in1))==(atom_getsym(in2)))
00232                 //if(in1[0].a_w.w_sym == in2[0].a_w.w_sym)
00233                         return true;
00234         }
00235         return false;
00236 }
